intro.title: Would your company benefit from an update to the way compliance training is conducted?
intro.subtitle: Answer 12 quick questions to see if a scenario-based, AIâ€‘driven approach to compliance training could improve engagement, reduce risk, and save time for your organization.

items.text: Employees are engaged and motivated during compliance training sessions.
Compliance training is seen as relevant and valuable by employees.
Employees complete compliance training on time without frequent reminders.
Compliance incidents rarely occur due to lack of awareness or understanding.
Updating compliance training materials is quick and straightforward.
Training content is regularly updated to reflect new regulations or company policies.
Employees collaborate or discuss real-world compliance scenarios during training.
The organization uses interactive or gamified elements in compliance training.
AI or technology is leveraged to personalize or enhance compliance learning.
Feedback from employees is used to improve compliance training content.
Tracking and reporting on compliance training completion is efficient and automated.
Employees can easily access support or mentorship during compliance training.

needPercentage.label: not-needed
needPercentage.displayText: Your compliance training is highly effective, engaging, and up-to-date.

needPercentage.label: low
needPercentage.displayText: Compliance training is strong, with minor opportunities for improvement.

needPercentage.label: medium
needPercentage.displayText: Engagement and effectiveness are inconsistent across teams.

needPercentage.label: high
needPercentage.displayText: Significant gaps exist in compliance training engagement or process.

needPercentage.label: critical
needPercentage.displayText: Compliance training is outdated, ineffective, or not widely adopted.

summary.text: Your compliance training program is a model of best practice. Consider sharing your approach with others.
A few targeted updates or enhancements could further strengthen your compliance training.
A modern, engaging approach could help standardize compliance understanding and reduce risk.
A comprehensive update to your compliance training is recommended to address key gaps.
An urgent overhaul of compliance training is needed to ensure legal and ethical standards are met.

recommendations: Continue to monitor and update training as regulations evolve
Share best practices with other departments or organizations
Encourage peer-led compliance discussions
Leverage advanced analytics to maintain high engagement
Introduce gamified or interactive elements to boost engagement
Solicit regular feedback from employees to fine-tune content
Pilot AI-driven case studies for advanced teams
Automate reminders and tracking for even higher completion rates
Adopt a gamified, AI-driven platform like TeamLearn
Update training content to reflect real-world scenarios
Facilitate collaborative problem-solving sessions
Implement dynamic content updates for regulatory changes
Launch a company-wide compliance training refresh
Pair training with hands-on, scenario-based exercises
Automate tracking and reporting to reduce admin burden
Establish compliance champions in each team
Implement mandatory, interactive compliance training immediately
Leverage AI agents to update and personalize content rapidly
Create a feedback loop for continuous improvement
Establish oversight to monitor compliance incidents and training impact

narrative.intro: Your compliance training program is highly effective, engaging, and up-to-date. Employees are motivated, complete training on time, and understand the importance of compliance.
narrative.main_text: Training materials are regularly updated, and employees actively participate in collaborative, real-world scenarios. Technology and analytics are leveraged to personalize learning and track progress. Feedback is routinely gathered and used to improve the program. The organization demonstrates a culture of compliance and continuous improvement.
narrative.conclusion: Your compliance training is a model of best practice. Consider sharing your approach with others.

impact.title: Impact
impact.description: This excellence in compliance training likely results in:
points: High completion rates and engagement
Low incidence of compliance breaches
Efficient adaptation to regulatory changes
Strong organizational reputation

next_steps.title: Next Steps
next_steps.description: To maintain your high standards, consider:
points: Continue to monitor and update training as regulations evolve
Share best practices with other departments or organizations
Encourage peer-led compliance discussions
Leverage advanced analytics to maintain high engagement

narrative.intro: Your compliance training is effective, but there are minor gaps in engagement or content relevance. Most employees complete training on time, but some require reminders.
narrative.main_text: Training materials are updated, but not always as quickly as needed. Interactive or gamified elements are limited, and feedback is not always acted upon. There is room to further personalize and modernize the experience.
narrative.conclusion: A few targeted updates or enhancements could further strengthen your compliance training.

impact.title: Impact
impact.description: These minor gaps may result in:
points: Occasional delays in completion
Missed opportunities for engagement
Slightly increased risk of compliance incidents
Slower adaptation to regulatory changes

next_steps.title: Next Steps
points: Introduce gamified or interactive elements to boost engagement
Solicit regular feedback from employees to fine-tune content
Pilot AI-driven case studies for advanced teams
Automate reminders and tracking for even higher completion rates

narrative.intro: Engagement and effectiveness of compliance training are inconsistent across teams. Some employees value the training, while others see it as a checkbox exercise.
narrative.main_text: Training content is sometimes outdated, and updates are slow to implement. Collaboration and real-world problem solving are limited. Technology is underutilized, and tracking completions is time-consuming.
narrative.conclusion: A modern, engaging approach could help standardize compliance understanding and reduce risk.

impact.title: Impact
points: Variable compliance across teams
Increased risk of incidents
Administrative burden for tracking and reminders
Missed opportunities for learning and improvement

next_steps.title: Next Steps
next_steps.description: To improve consistency and impact, consider:
points: Adopt a gamified, AI-driven platform like TeamLearn
Update training content to reflect real-world scenarios
Facilitate collaborative problem-solving sessions
Implement dynamic content updates for regulatory changes

narrative.intro: Significant gaps exist in compliance training engagement or process. Many employees require frequent reminders, and training is often seen as irrelevant.
narrative.main_text: Content updates are slow, and incidents occur due to lack of awareness. There is little collaboration or use of technology, and tracking completions is largely manual.
narrative.conclusion: A comprehensive update to your compliance training is recommended to address key gaps.

impact.title: Impact
points: Frequent compliance incidents
High administrative burden
Low engagement and completion rates
Difficulty adapting to new regulations

next_steps.title: Next Steps
points: Launch a company-wide compliance training refresh
Pair training with hands-on, scenario-based exercises
Automate tracking and reporting to reduce admin burden
Establish compliance champions in each team

narrative.intro: Compliance training is outdated, ineffective, or not widely adopted. Employees are disengaged, and incidents occur due to lack of knowledge or care.
narrative.main_text: Training content is rarely updated, and there is no system for feedback or improvement. Technology is not used, and tracking is manual and error-prone. The organization is at significant risk of compliance failures.
narrative.conclusion: An urgent overhaul of compliance training is needed to ensure legal and ethical standards are met.

impact.title: Impact
impact.description: This lack of effective training may result in:
points: High risk of compliance breaches
Legal and financial penalties
Reputational damage
Operational disruptions

next_steps.title: Next Steps
points: Implement mandatory, interactive compliance training immediately
Leverage AI agents to update and personalize content rapidly
Create a feedback loop for continuous improvement
Establish oversight to monitor compliance incidents and training impact
